attributes.comment:
Adopting foreign children is one of the few activities that is actually enhancing the
international image of the United States. Increasing the adoption fees will make it
more difficult for aspiring middle-class parents to provide a loving home for children
in need. At a time when the eroding international reputation of the United States
is feeding the flames of the terrorism that we seek to conquer, it makes no sense
to make it more difficult for Americans to play a positive role in the international
community.

Moreover, it is hard to imagine that the proposed increases, multiplied by the
number of international adoptions, will have a significant impact on the budget.
How ironic that we continue to spend billions on controlling the damage that the
debacle in Iraq has wrought upon our reputation, while at the same time nickel
and diming adoptive parents of foreign children. These people have the potential
to be a positive force for good in the world, and they are already bearing a
substantial financial burden. The total cost for a foreign adoption can be $20,000-
$30,000.

Foreign adoptions are consistent with the traditional role of America as country
that provides a helping hand to those in need. This is precisely the sort of activity
that we should be encouraging.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Stephen M. Gilbert
